text:
The main benefit I've seen mentioned is security. Rust even beats Go according to the Azure team that used it: <https://medium.com/the-innovation/how-microsoft-is-adopting-rust-e0f8816566ba>

For platforms, performance and security are massive. And the further you go down the stack, the less you have a mess of software dependencies, which makes a rewrite more feasible.

Plus, Rust's compiler means you need to rely less on the experience and discipline of each of your programmers, since it's much harder to accidentally write exploitable bugs.
